courses.title: Elementary French I
courses.description: Introduction to listening, speaking, reading, and writing in French and to the culture of French-speaking regions.

courses.title: Elementary French II
courses.description: Continued listening, speaking, reading, and writing in French with further study of the culture of French-speaking regions.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in French.

courses.title: Intermediate French I
courses.description: A rapid review of grammar with continued use of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in French, all with a cultural emphasis.

courses.title: Intermediate French II
courses.description: This course focuses on listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in French in an introduction to literature and within a cultural context.

courses.title: LBAT French Culture and Language
courses.description: Proficiency-based introduction to sociocultural aspects of the French speaking world.  Part of the French intensive summer LBAT program.  Admission by application only. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Internship Assistantship
courses.description: Modern Language Undergraduate Internship for pay for freshmen and sophomores, by permit only. The internship experience must be at a unit or agency approved by the School of Modern Language.

courses.title: Undergraduate Internship
courses.description: Modern Language Undergraduate Internship for credit for freshmen and sophomores, by permit only. The internship experience must be at a unit or agency approved by the School of Modern Languages.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in French.

courses.title: Survey of French Literature
courses.description: This course introduces students to French literature.  Taught in French.

courses.title: French Literature from 1800 to 1900
courses.description: Romanticism, the reappearance of lyric poetry, the importance of the individual as opposed to classical anonymity. Realism and naturalism with emphasis on the development of the novel. Conducted in French.

courses.title: French Literature from 1900 to Present
courses.description: Exploration of currents in modern prose, poetry, and drama. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Drama Workshop
courses.description: Literary and theatrical aspects of French drama are explored through class discussion and performance of selections from contemporary and classical plays.

courses.title: France Today I
courses.description: Culture, history, and geography of modern France through lectures, videos, downloads from the Internet, audio recordings, digital media, and class discussions. Short papers treating assigned topics to enhance writing skills. Conducted in French.

courses.title: France Today II
courses.description: Culture, history, and geography of modern France through lectures, videos, audio recordings, digital media, and class discussions. Short papers treating assigned topics to enhance writing skills. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Introduction to Contemporary France
courses.description: This course will introduce students to issues in contemporary France.  Taught in French.

courses.title: Social Identities in Contemporary French Culture
courses.description: Analysis of production, reception and perceptions of clashing class identities in France via films, novels, plays, short stories, and newspapers.  Conducted in French.

courses.title: Paris:  Modernity Today
courses.description: This course explores contemporary Paris and its representations in light of its modern history and culture.  Taught in French.

courses.title: French Phonetics
courses.description: A detailed analysis of the significant features of the French sound system, intonation curves, and graphic representation of individual sounds. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Reading and Translation
courses.description: This course will prepare students for the techniques of rapid reading in French, and give them tools to translate and use texts.  Taught in French.

courses.title: France: Culture, Economy, Commerce I
courses.description: Advanced Business French, overview of French commerce, communications, publicity, various social milieus, and the work place. Taught in French.

courses.title: France: Culture, Economy and Commerce II
courses.description: Advanced Business French. Overview of French commerce, communications, publicity, various social milieus, and the work place. Taught in French.

courses.title: Comics & Graphic Arts
courses.description: This course studies French comics as a genre and its interrelationships with graphic arts and literature. Conducted in French.

courses.title: French Conversation and Culture
courses.description: This class is designed to help students improve their French speaking skills, and use French at an advanced level. Not for beginners. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Advanced Composition
courses.description: In-depth study of advanced grammar patterns as used in written expressions. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Introduction to Africa
courses.description: This interdisciplinary course will use a variety of approaches to study significant aspects of contemporary Africaâ€™s societies, cultures, and representations. Taught in English.

courses.title: Field Work Abroad
courses.description: This course will focus on theme-based individual projects abroad.

courses.title: Sustainable Communities in France
courses.description: Examines social, cultural, artistic and environmental dimensions of sustainability and concepts of identity, diversity, social equity and inclusion/exclusion in the French context. Taught in French.

courses.title: French for the Professions I
courses.description: Study aspects of literature, philosophy, culture, geography, history, business, and industry in France and other Francophone countries in these applied-language courses. Taught in French.

courses.title: Business Communication and Correspondence in France
courses.description: Refinement of accuracy and flexibility in oral/written expression. Focus on appropriate use of strategies, business negotiation protocols, lexical precision.  Incorporates grammar review.  Part of the French intensive summer language program. Admission by application only.

courses.title: French for Business and Technology I
courses.description: Study of business, technological, and cultural issues, tendencies and patterns of behavior among French-speaking people.  Value systems and their manifestations. Part of the French intensive summer language program.  Admission by application only.

courses.title: French for Business and Technology II
courses.description: Business organizations and use of technology in France. Specialized vocabularies of economics, engineering, and computer science.  Attention to geographical and anthropological aspects of selected social and political situations.  Part of the French intensive summer language program.  Admission by application only.

courses.title: French for Business and Technology Abroad
courses.description: Two-week seminar in France highlighting business and technology.  Field study of technology firms, economic trends, business institutions, and cultural protocols. Journals and papers assigned.  Admission by application only.

courses.title: Sustainability in Paris
courses.description: This course examines sustainable development and communities in Paris, France. Topics include urban planning, environmental sustainability, use of energy, and social issues. Taught in French.

courses.title: Paris in Cinema/Cinema in Paris
courses.description: This course offers an in-depth look at the history, industry, and scope of French cinema through the myth of Paris in films.  Conducted in French.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Permits a group of students and a professor to pursue areas of the French language not covered in other courses in the department.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in French.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in French.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in French.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in French.

courses.title: French Stylistics
courses.description: Advanced study of syntax and semantics, aimed at development of stylistic sensitivity. Analysis of representative literary and current interest texts for practice in conversation and composition. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Contemporary French Literature
courses.description: This course will study contemporary French authors and their ideas in context, with a focus on specific authors or texts. Taught in French.

courses.title: French Art
courses.description: This course will thematically explore French visual, conceptual, and performance art in the historical, theoretical, and cultural contexts of production and reception.

courses.title: French Literature and the Visual Arts
courses.description: This course studies French Literature and its interrelationships with various arts (painting, music, cinema, architecture or opera), often through several periods.  Conducted in French.

courses.title: Sustainability & Development in the Francophone World
courses.description: This course will analyze current sustainability & development issues in the Francophone World and policies initiated to address them. Taught in French.

courses.title: Politics and Public Policy in France
courses.description: This course will analyze current issues in French society and the public policies initiated to address them. Taught in French.

courses.title: Food, Arts And Media
courses.description: This course will focus on the culture of food in French arts, literature and media, examining its social and symbolic values through the centuries. Taught in French.

courses.title: Literature of the Francophone World I
courses.description: Exploration of the literature of the Francophone world. Currents in modern prose, poetry, and drama. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Francophone Africa
courses.description: This interdisciplinary course will explore contemporary Francophone Africa and its representations in light of its modern history and culture.  Taught in French.

courses.title: Francophone Cinema
courses.description: This course will explore through films representations of Francophone regions of the world from Africa to the Caribbean. Taught in French.

courses.title: Gender in French-Speaking Societies
courses.description: Course explores the intersection of gender with French history, politics, ethics, laws, professions, medical fields, social classes, religious, nationalisms, and (perceived) ethnicity. Taught in French.

courses.title: Arts and Power in Paris: Architecture, Urban Art, Visual Arts, Literature, and More
courses.description: Explores the relationship between power and the arts throughout the history of Paris in sculpture, architecture, tapestry, songs, painting, literature, photography, etc. Taught in French.

courses.title: Introduction to French Philosophy
courses.description: Introduction to major French philosophical texts with an emphasis on post-WWI thinkers (includes Existentialism, Structuralism, Post-Structuralism, Postmodernism, Deconstructionism).  Conducted in French.

courses.title: Science in the French Imagination
courses.description: This course explores the relationships between literature and science, culture, and technology from the late 18th to the 21st century. Taught in French.

courses.title: Migration in French Cinema
courses.description: A topical approach focusing on the major contributions of French cinema and cinematographic aesthetics, from the 1900s to contemporary films.  Conducted in French.

courses.title: The French New Wave
courses.description: In-depth and concentrated study of French cinema. Particular attention devoted to the French New Wave, the development of film theory and criticism in France. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Women in Film
courses.description: This course will explore representations of women in French films and women's roles in the film industry. Taught in French.

courses.title: French and Francophone Films and Media
courses.description: This course examines socio-historical, political, economic and cultural issues through films and other media in France and/or the Francophone world. Taught in French.

courses.title: Reading Les Miserables
courses.description: This course examines in its entirety the world-famous novel from Victor Hugo: Les Miserables within its artistic and social environments and messages. Taught in French.

courses.title: France and Globalization
courses.description: Intercultural class about French attitudes and policies toward globalization as well as France's role in the European Community.  Conducted in French.

courses.title: Advanced Intercultural Seminar
courses.description: Integrates cross-cultural research and reflection into discussion of current issues in the French-speaking world.  Intended for students who have some study-abroad experience in a French-speaking country.  Conducted in French.

courses.title: Internship Assitantship
courses.description: Modern Language Undergraduate Internship for pay for junior and seniors, by permit only. The internship experience must be at a unit or agency approved by the School of Modern Languages.

courses.title: French Internship
courses.description: Professional experience with a business/organization in which students enhance their language skills and cultural knowledge in French in relation to the practical goals/objectives of the entity.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of interest not covered in the regular course offerings.

courses.title: Contemporary French Literature
courses.description: This course will study contemporary French authors and their ideas in context, with a focus on specific authors or texts. Taught in French.

courses.title: French Art
courses.description: This course will thematically explore French visual, conceptual, and performance art in the historical, theoretical, and cultural contexts of production and reception.

courses.title: Literature & Visual Arts
courses.description: This course examines the relationship between Word and Image (including cinema/ film adaptations, photography, hypertext, graphic design, and diverse artistic genres). Taught in French.

courses.title: Sustainability & Development in the Francophone World
courses.description: This course will analyze current sustainability & development issues in the Francophone World, and policies initiated to address them. Taught in French.

courses.title: FOOD, ARTS & MEDIA
courses.description: This course will focus on the culture of food in French arts, literature and media, examining its social and symbolic values through the centuries. In French.

courses.title: Contemporary Francophone Literature
courses.description: This course will analyze Francophone Literatures produced outside of France since 1960 with a focus on their modern and innovative aspects. Taught in French.

courses.title: Francophone Africa
courses.description: This interdisciplinary course will explore contemporary Francophone Africa and its representations in light of its modern history and culture.  Taught in French.

courses.title: Francophone Cinema
courses.description: This course will explore through films representations of Francophone regions of the world from Africa to the Caribbean. Taught in French.

courses.title: SCIENCE IN THE FRENCH IMAGINATION
courses.description: This course explores the relationships between literature and science, culture, and technology from the late 18th to the 21st century. Taught in French.

courses.title: French Domestic Internship
courses.description: Students complete domestic internships. Conducted in French. Online course.

courses.title: France and Globalization
courses.description: Intercultural class about French attitudes and policies toward globalization as well as France's role in the European Community. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Intercultural Seminar
courses.description: Integrates cross-cultural research and reflection into discussion of current issues in the French-speaking world. Taught in French.

courses.title: Professional Portfolio Development
courses.description: Preparation of a professional portfolio connecting experiences and coursework in the MS program towards career preparation. Conducted in French.

courses.title: Applied Language Practicum
courses.description: Students will serve as researchers, student aides and apprentice instructors for any 3/4000-level undergraduate course approved by their adviser and the course.

courses.title: Applied Language Practicum Abroad
courses.description: Students serve as researchers and apprentice instructors in the LBAT or other faculty-led overseas language immersion program of the School of Modern Languages.

courses.title: French Internship Abroad
courses.description: Students complete internships abroad in a French-speaking country. Conducted in French. Online course.

courses.title: French Internship Abroad
courses.description: Students complete internships abroad in a French-speaking country. Conducted in French. Online course.

courses.title: Master's Project
courses.description: Optional project course taught in French.

courses.title: Master's Thesis
courses.description: Optional thesis course.
